GOD.content: God of Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, not the God of philosophers of ontotheology, but one who interrupts & retracts his order
GOD.linkedContent: God of Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, not the God of philosophers of ontotheology, but one who interrupts & retracts his order

GOD.linkedContent: Judaic God repents, feels remorse, takes back his commands—i.e. the flood, his gesture resembles a confession, a plea for forgiveness [Christ is constantly taking back?]

FK.content: the reaction to radical evil at the heart of Freudian thought, interminable Jewish question [?]
FK.linkedContent: the reaction to radical evil at the heart of Freudian thought, interminable Jewish question [?]

AF.content: Jew (or Devil, radical evil, all which is irreconcilable to God in “Christian science”) can be reinvested as an economistic resource of an archive that capitalizes everything [Sagi]
AF.linkedContent: Jew (or Devil, radical evil, all which is irreconcilable to God in “Christian science”) can be reinvested as an economistic resource of an archive that capitalizes everything [Sagi]

AF.content: devil can justify, such is destination of Jew in Aryan ideal

AF.content: classically—science, philosophy, intrinsically independent of the singular archive of its history

AF.content: via Yerushalmi, but w/ a Jewish science, archive becomes a founding moment for science as such

AF.content: acc. Yerushalmi, psychoanalysis would be Judaism w/out God

AF.content: indetermination en abyme when Yerushalmi in-determines Jewishness & science one by the other

AF.content: along with openness to future, via Yerushalmi,  Jew has historicity, obligation of memory, of the archive

AF.content: 2 specificities, exclusivities, responsibilities, in absolute privilege of election
is Jewishness the absolute uniqueness of this trait? to be open toward the future (à-venir), to be Jewish?: exemplary uniqueness of the trait d’union [btwn Jewishness & future]
AF.linkedContent: is Jewishness the absolute uniqueness of this trait? to be open toward the future (à-venir), to be Jewish?: exemplary uniqueness of the trait d’union [btwn Jewishness & future]

AF.linkedContent: remember to remember the future, Yerushalmi: “only in Israel and nowhere else is the injunction to remember felt as a religious imperative to an entire people” [makes Derrida tremble]

VM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, the Site, not an empirical Here but always an Illic, for Jew & for Poet

VM.content: worst violence (what some call Judaic experience of infinitely other), when one silently delivers oneself into hands of other in the night

VM.content: to live in difference btwn Jew and Greek, perhaps the unity we call history

VM.content: Abraham exemplar of unhappy consciousness for Hegel

S.content: Jewish thought as inexhaustible thinking of fire
S.linkedContent: Jewish thought as inexhaustible thinking of fire

SH.content: what is proper to the Jew is to have no property of essence > Jewish is not Jewish
SH.linkedContent: what is proper to the Jew is to have no property of essence > Jewish is not Jewish

SH.content: (in its fearful political ambiguity state of Israel could be named shibboleth) [in parentheses]
SH.linkedContent: (in its fearful political ambiguity state of Israel could be named shibboleth) [in parentheses]

SH.content: anyone who experiences circumcision (body cut, shibboleth, blessing, purification) is a Jew
SH.linkedContent: anyone who experiences circumcision (body cut, shibboleth, blessing, purification) is a Jew

SH.content: displace literality of belonging if, w/ Judaism, nothing properly belongs, anyone or no one may be a Jew, Jew: no one’s name, the only one, no one's circumcision
SH.linkedContent: displace literality of belonging if, w/ Judaism, nothing properly belongs, anyone or no one may be a Jew, Jew: no one’s name, the only one, no one's circumcision

FWT.content: incalculable inner multiplicity is Derrida’s torment, his work, travail, his tripalium, passion, labor, also that which makes him work > I do not believe this division/nonidentity to oneself is exemplarily Jewish, but who would dare say it isn’t?
FWT.linkedContent: incalculable inner multiplicity is Derrida’s torment, his work, travail, his tripalium, passion, labor, also that which makes him work > I do not believe this division/nonidentity to oneself is exemplarily Jewish, but who would dare say it isn’t?

FWT.content: nothing matters more to Derrida than his Jewishness, & it matters so little
FWT.linkedContent: nothing matters more to Derrida than his Jewishness, & it matters so little

FWT.content: to say “I’m Jewish, I can’t be accused when disconcerted by Israel”—programmed death of slightest lucidity, responsibility, deadly trap must be avoided at all costs
FWT.linkedContent: to say “I’m Jewish, I can’t be accused when disconcerted by Israel”—programmed death of slightest lucidity, responsibility, deadly trap must be avoided at all costs

FWT.linkedContent: the worst thing [re: making use of Holocaust]: appropriation and instrumentalization of historical memory

FWT.content: against Sartre’s idea that anti-Semitism produces the Jew
FWT.linkedContent: against Sartre’s idea that anti-Semitism produces the Jew

POOF.content: when Blanchot claims that Judaism was the foundation of our relationships w/ the other (autri), Derrida believes this is highly problematic while possessing imposing necessity (this is unquestionable when one calls Judaism the thing one defines: a circle Derrida can’t engage here [heterotautology?]) > Derrida wonders why he can’t subscribe, like Blanchot, to words “community” or this statement on Judaism—which response is more hyperbolically Jewish?

P.linkedContent: for Kant & Hegel, pas crossing line finite/infinite interrupts symbolic beauty > Judaism as historical figure of sublime irruption: ban on representation (Kant), Hebraic poetry (Hegel)

SP.linkedContent: the double role of woman as truth’s recession, and as the nonbeliever in truth, she is like the Jew in her “delight in dissimulation,” affirmative power

SP.linkedContent: does Nietzsche refer to Jew because of the way circumcision marks simulation & castration?

ATIA.linkedContent: [via Adorno] the idealist conjuration, the making totem/taboo, insulting materialism, hatred for the animal [the animal that therefore I am as self-hatred]: the Jew, the woman

ATIA.linkedContent: principle of life (torat haïm) never prevented animal sacrifice in Judaism

PS.linkedContent: [using Blanchot’s pathetic error, Derrida shows how Artaud's unique example, his history, will be erased on the way to truth, given to the doctors: a pre-Hegelian treatment]

SW.content: [re: Exodus 26:31] there are 2 veils/curtains btwn [holy/sanctuary] tabernacle & [holy/sanctuary] tabernacle of tabernacles [of holies/of sanctuaries] > 1st embroidered by artist, 2nd merely the work of a carpenter
SW.linkedContent: [re: Exodus 26:31] there are 2 veils/curtains btwn [holy/sanctuary] tabernacle & [holy/sanctuary] tabernacle of tabernacles [of holies/of sanctuaries] > 1st embroidered by artist, 2nd merely the work of a carpenter

SW.content: God as name of what gives the order to give the veil (btwn holy & holy of holies), veil as gift (that it is) ordered to give, gives to think separation from le tout autre (faith itself) > did this come to an end w/ death of Christ? can it be comprehended in veiled folds of Greek alētheia?
SW.linkedContent: God as name of what gives the order to give the veil (btwn holy & holy of holies), veil as gift (that it is) ordered to give, gives to think separation from le tout autre (faith itself) > did this come to an end w/ death of Christ? can it be comprehended in veiled folds of Greek alētheia?

SW.content: verdict neither torn nor lifted cloth > if veil is neither torn nor lifted is it still not hung btwn holy & holy of holies? > who knows? we must dare the “perhaps”: “the fulgurating nearness of this day depends/tends” toward who or what I know not yet
SW.linkedContent: verdict neither torn nor lifted cloth > if veil is neither torn nor lifted is it still not hung btwn holy & holy of holies? > who knows? we must dare the “perhaps”: “the fulgurating nearness of this day depends/tends” toward who or what I know not yet

DPi.content: the transition, the trance btwn when Jews have received commandments but have yet to hear the “judgments” > as if they know God’s about to invent DP after uttering “thou shalt not kill,” terrified by this divine word electing them > Moses says, “Do not tremble”
DPi.linkedContent: the transition, the trance btwn when Jews have received commandments but have yet to hear the “judgments” > as if they know God’s about to invent DP after uttering “thou shalt not kill,” terrified by this divine word electing them > Moses says, “Do not tremble”

DST.linkedContent: [re: Reik] Derrida asks: can we link that which is not yet ontotypological or mimetological in pre-Platonic Greece w/ experience of non-musical Jewish shofar?

WAP.content: acc. Hegel, Jew is kindisch (childish) not kindlich (childlike) like Christian because docile, submissive to heteronomy of their God [shows profound homology btwn Hegel’s pedagogical theory and entire philosophical teleology]
WAP.linkedContent: acc. Hegel, Jew is kindisch (childish) not kindlich (childlike) like Christian because docile, submissive to heteronomy of their God [shows profound homology btwn Hegel’s pedagogical theory and entire philosophical teleology]

EJQB.content: what’s in question: the incommensurable destiny of Judaism (as birth/passion of writing) that grafts (ente) “race born of the book” onto radical origin of meaning as literality, onto historicity itself: no history sans le sérieux (gravity) and labor of literality
EJQB.linkedContent: what’s in question: the incommensurable destiny of Judaism (as birth/passion of writing) that grafts (ente) “race born of the book” onto radical origin of meaning as literality, onto historicity itself: no history sans le sérieux (gravity) and labor of literality

EJQB.content: history: the only thing that begins by reflecting itself > this fold, this furrow (ride), is the Jew
EJQB.linkedContent: history: the only thing that begins by reflecting itself > this fold, this furrow (ride), is the Jew

EJQB.content: Jew elects writing which elects the Jews > responsible for truth’s suffusion w/ historicity, and history’s assignment of itself (s’assigne) to its empiricity
EJQB.linkedContent: Jew elects writing which elects the Jews > responsible for truth’s suffusion w/ historicity, and history’s assignment of itself (s’assigne) to its empiricity

EJQB.content: [vis-à-vis Jabès] situation of Jew exemplary for situation of poet
EJQB.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Jabès] situation of Jew exemplary for situation of poet

EJQB.content: wisdom of poet culminates its freedom in passion of translating obedience to the law of the word into autonomy > w/out which, and if passion becomes subjection, poet is mad
EJQB.linkedContent: wisdom of poet culminates its freedom in passion of translating obedience to the law of the word into autonomy > w/out which, and if passion becomes subjection, poet is mad

EJQB.content: poet & Jew: born (not here) elsewhere, autochthons only of speech & writing, of Law: sons of the land to come
EJQB.linkedContent: poet & Jew: born (not here) elsewhere, autochthons only of speech & writing, of Law: sons of the land to come

EJQB.content: site of freedom whose cult is not necessarily pagan, not an enclosure, ghetto, site of exclusion: when a Jew proclaims the Site, not a declaration of war, site is not empirical/national, it is immemorial, a future too, tradition as adventure > freedom granted to nonpagan Land only if separated from freedom by Desert of the Promise (Land keeping itself beyond proximity)
EJQB.linkedContent: site of freedom whose cult is not necessarily pagan, not an enclosure, ghetto, site of exclusion: when a Jew proclaims the Site, not a declaration of war, site is not empirical/national, it is immemorial, a future too, tradition as adventure > freedom granted to nonpagan Land only if separated from freedom by Desert of the Promise (Land keeping itself beyond proximity)

EJQB.content: separation of life & thought: infinite anchoritism (writing as moment of Desert, Judaic experience as reflection)
EJQB.linkedContent: separation of life & thought: infinite anchoritism (writing as moment of Desert, Judaic experience as reflection)

EJQB.content: Pharisees, those misunderstood men of literality, the “separated ones”
EJQB.linkedContent: Pharisees, those misunderstood men of literality, the “separated ones”

EJQB.content: Jewish consciousness is the unhappy consciousness
nemein: common root of division, naming, nomadism > nomadic Jew struck by infinity & the letter in the desert
EJQB.linkedContent: nemein: common root of division, naming, nomadism > nomadic Jew struck by infinity & the letter in the desert

EJQB.content: poet or Jew: protects the desert that protects his speech (can speak only in desert), his writing (traced [sillonner] only in desert) > invents unfindable/unspecifiable pathway (un chemin introuvable et inassigné) > dont aucune résolution cartésienne ne peut nous assurer la droite ligne et l’issue
EJQB.linkedContent: poet or Jew: protects the desert that protects his speech (can speak only in desert), his writing (traced [sillonner] only in desert) > invents unfindable/unspecifiable pathway (un chemin introuvable et inassigné) > dont aucune résolution cartésienne ne peut nous assurer la droite ligne et l’issue

EJQB.linkedContent: via Jabès, Jew’s destiny: summoned btwn voice/cipher (acc. Levinas, btwn Socratic/Hebraic, btwn poverty/wealth of letter, btwn pneumatic/grammatical)

EJQB.content: can one sever oneself from Jewish community?
EJQB.linkedContent: can one sever oneself from Jewish community?

EJQB.content: [re: Jabès] Jew reproached by rabbinical Jews for universalism, skeletal (décharnés) allegorism, for neutralizing event in realms of symbolic/imaginary [Jew as suffering allegory]
EJQB.linkedContent: [re: Jabès] Jew reproached by rabbinical Jews for universalism, skeletal (décharnés) allegorism, for neutralizing event in realms of symbolic/imaginary [Jew as suffering allegory]

EJQB.content: Jew’s identification w/ himself doesn’t exist
EJQB.linkedContent: Jew’s identification w/ himself doesn’t exist

EJQB.content: Jew is split btwn 2 dimensions of letter: 1) allegory (no history, abstract universalism, cold skin of concept) 2) literality (empirical, actualized history, too warm flesh)
EJQB.linkedContent: Jew is split btwn 2 dimensions of letter: 1) allegory (no history, abstract universalism, cold skin of concept) 2) literality (empirical, actualized history, too warm flesh)

IW.content: for Rosenzweig, Jewish speech: dissociative, irruptive power, convulsive rhythm of volcanic production
IW.linkedContent: for Rosenzweig, Jewish speech: dissociative, irruptive power, convulsive rhythm of volcanic production

IW.content: coming of an event initiates irruption, interruption of totalizing synthesis
IW.linkedContent: coming of an event initiates irruption, interruption of totalizing synthesis

IW.content: Jew and German: “lack of transition,” a ruptivity, “and,” a continuity outside dialectical synthesis > disjunctive conjunction, aphoristic seriality
IW.linkedContent: Jew and German: “lack of transition,” a ruptivity, “and,” a continuity outside dialectical synthesis > disjunctive conjunction, aphoristic seriality

IW.content: Rosenzweig in reference to Cohen’s overflowing, volcanic, teaching habits: “nothing more Jewish than this lack of transition”
IW.linkedContent: Rosenzweig in reference to Cohen’s overflowing, volcanic, teaching habits: “nothing more Jewish than this lack of transition”

IW.content: for Adorno, Kant star witness of German tradition/mind; for Cohen, relation btwn Judaism/Kantianism: historical culmination of idealism as essence of German philosophy
IW.linkedContent: for Adorno, Kant star witness of German tradition/mind; for Cohen, relation btwn Judaism/Kantianism: historical culmination of idealism as essence of German philosophy

IW.content: acc. Cohen, exile of Judaism to Alexandria, its Hellinization (Jewgreek), made it cosmopolitan, universalized it: Greek the 3rd term which brings German and Jew together
IW.linkedContent: acc. Cohen, exile of Judaism to Alexandria, its Hellinization (Jewgreek), made it cosmopolitan, universalized it: Greek the 3rd term which brings German and Jew together

IW.content: acc. Cohen, Philo (a Führer), Plato’s Jewish heir: prepared the way for Christianity > part of a current that reconciled Hellenism w/ Judaism: mediation of logos & holy spirit
IW.linkedContent: acc. Cohen, Philo (a Führer), Plato’s Jewish heir: prepared the way for Christianity > part of a current that reconciled Hellenism w/ Judaism: mediation of logos & holy spirit

IW.content: if, for Cohen, race is reducible to biologico-naturalist schema, racism not of issue re: Jew & the German, they relate through psyche, artificially, nonnaturally: alliance of religious & philosophical
IW.linkedContent: if, for Cohen, race is reducible to biologico-naturalist schema, racism not of issue re: Jew & the German, they relate through psyche, artificially, nonnaturally: alliance of religious & philosophical

IW.content: if German-Jewish relation is a delirium, cannot be made into object (such object being an “artificial” reflection), then Cohen’s discourse on it could very well be symptom of madness it describes, but a true symptom: a truth it speaks that’s not of order of positive objectivity
IW.linkedContent: if German-Jewish relation is a delirium, cannot be made into object (such object being an “artificial” reflection), then Cohen’s discourse on it could very well be symptom of madness it describes, but a true symptom: a truth it speaks that’s not of order of positive objectivity

IW.content: acc. Cohen, only Judeo-German, only Judeo-Protestant (no Judeo-Catholic, no Judeo-Muslim)
IW.linkedContent: acc. Cohen, only Judeo-German, only Judeo-Protestant (no Judeo-Catholic, no Judeo-Muslim)

IW.content: acc. Cohen, German Protestantism absolutely privileged, unique mimesis of Greek ideas [“Christianity is unthinkable w/out logos”], Reformation opposes logos, eidos, hypotheton to ecclesial dogma > [p. 257 ensures unique relation of German-Jew]
IW.linkedContent: acc. Cohen, German Protestantism absolutely privileged, unique mimesis of Greek ideas [“Christianity is unthinkable w/out logos”], Reformation opposes logos, eidos, hypotheton to ecclesial dogma > [p. 257 ensures unique relation of German-Jew]

IW.content: acc. Cohen, Kant is holy of holies, innermost sanctum of German spirit, & Kant represents most intimate affinity (die innerste Verwandschaft) w/ Judaism
IW.linkedContent: acc. Cohen, Kant is holy of holies, innermost sanctum of German spirit, & Kant represents most intimate affinity (die innerste Verwandschaft) w/ Judaism

IW.content: this kinship (Kant, German, Jew) is sealed in most intimate depth, most essential interiority, is sacredness itself, historical sacredness of spirit > p. 262 absolute interiority
IW.linkedContent: this kinship (Kant, German, Jew) is sealed in most intimate depth, most essential interiority, is sacredness itself, historical sacredness of spirit > p. 262 absolute interiority

IW.content: it’s as if Cohen tells Jews/Catholics: recognize the Protestant spirit that already inhabits you: a demand for hypothesis, truth, science, beyond instituted dogma [Jewish & German]
IW.linkedContent: it’s as if Cohen tells Jews/Catholics: recognize the Protestant spirit that already inhabits you: a demand for hypothesis, truth, science, beyond instituted dogma [Jewish & German]

IW.content: [vis-à-vis Cohen] Judeo-Protestant Platonism or world logocentrism made spiritual families possible, genealogy w/out limit, general economy (oikonomia, oikos as the law itself) > spiritual mondialisation: logos, spirit, idealism as moral conscience of philosophy & science
IW.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Cohen] Judeo-Protestant Platonism or world logocentrism made spiritual families possible, genealogy w/out limit, general economy (oikonomia, oikos as the law itself) > spiritual mondialisation: logos, spirit, idealism as moral conscience of philosophy & science

IW.content: Cohen translates “I am that I am” as God is Being (One), Jewish Yahweh merges w/ agathon, anhypotheton, escapes all image, perception: God is Love, Greco-Platonic Eros (at source of knowledge & aesthetic feeling) [Jew, Greek, Protestant]
IW.linkedContent: Cohen translates “I am that I am” as God is Being (One), Jewish Yahweh merges w/ agathon, anhypotheton, escapes all image, perception: God is Love, Greco-Platonic Eros (at source of knowledge & aesthetic feeling) [Jew, Greek, Protestant]

IW.content: Cohen thinks of Maimonides as medieval Jewish-Protestantism (founds religion on great, rigorous rationalism)
IW.linkedContent: Cohen thinks of Maimonides as medieval Jewish-Protestantism (founds religion on great, rigorous rationalism)

IW.content: for Cohen, 2 principles of Judaism: 1) God’s oneness 2) “purity of the soul”—this is the foundational pillar (Grundpfeiler) of Jewish piety
IW.linkedContent: for Cohen, 2 principles of Judaism: 1) God’s oneness 2) “purity of the soul”—this is the foundational pillar (Grundpfeiler) of Jewish piety

IW.content: Ibn Ezra, first to doubt Moses wrote 5 books (acc. Spinoza), says: human reason is mediator btwn God/Man, there is thus reconciliation (Versöhnung) btwn God/Man, and a redemption of man’s sins > for Cohen, in Judaism, redemption presupposes human psyche [pp. 271-72 Cohen’s Judeo-Protestantism, but how does he explain Jewish duty, commandments?]
IW.linkedContent: Ibn Ezra, first to doubt Moses wrote 5 books (acc. Spinoza), says: human reason is mediator btwn God/Man, there is thus reconciliation (Versöhnung) btwn God/Man, and a redemption of man’s sins > for Cohen, in Judaism, redemption presupposes human psyche [pp. 271-72 Cohen’s Judeo-Protestantism, but how does he explain Jewish duty, commandments?]

IW.content: acc. Cohen, Kant & Judaism both unite duty & freedom, universal law & autonomy > Kant’s thought interpreted as profound Judaism
IW.linkedContent: acc. Cohen, Kant & Judaism both unite duty & freedom, universal law & autonomy > Kant’s thought interpreted as profound Judaism

IW.content: Hegel’s philosophical antisemitism toward Kant (rather, anti-Judaism) reappears in Nietzsche’s contra Kant [?]
IW.linkedContent: Hegel’s philosophical antisemitism toward Kant (rather, anti-Judaism) reappears in Nietzsche’s contra Kant [?]

IW.content: though Kant includes an antisemitic note in Anthropology from a Pragmatic…, Cohen maintains Kant's quasi-Judaism > besides, w/ what is antisemitism not compatible?
IW.linkedContent: though Kant includes an antisemitic note in Anthropology from a Pragmatic…, Cohen maintains Kant's quasi-Judaism > besides, w/ what is antisemitism not compatible?

IW.content: Cohen’s vision of German-Jew is a psycho-spiritual truth not yet incarnate in historical effectivity [to explain factual antisemitism in Germany, in America too]
IW.linkedContent: Cohen’s vision of German-Jew is a psycho-spiritual truth not yet incarnate in historical effectivity [to explain factual antisemitism in Germany, in America too]

IW.content: re: Cohen’s Judeo-Kantian spirit, at deepest foundation of all morality, God’s law founds right and state, makes possible juridical feeling > analogy made to Kant’s feeling of respect: Kant states new Verbindungslinie btwn ethics & religion (gathers together soul & spirit)

IW.content: [vis-à-vis Rosenzweig] “unheard-of” singularity of Jewish nation: its birth belongs to (God’s) Law, not to nature > inscribed in a history that began before it was born (though it was already its own)—history of this nation: supernatural, transhistorical, prehistoric
